title: Simple circuits - switches X Y and 4 resistors

content.description: The figure shows a circuit comprised of two switches, four identical resistors, and a battery. The switches are labeled <math alttext="S sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="S sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, and the resistors are labeled <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>R</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub></math>. Consider the following two combinations of switch positions.
content.question: Combination <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>: <math alttext="S sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> is closed and <math alttext="S sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math> is open. There are <math alttext="n sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> resistors in the circuit that have a nonzero current.Combination <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>: <math alttext="S sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math> is open and <math alttext="S sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math> is closed. There are <math alttext="n sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> resistors in the circuit that have a nonzero current.Which of the following is a correct relation for <math alttext="n sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="n sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="n sub 1, is greater than open parenthesis, n sub 2 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="n sub 1, is greater than n sub 2, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="n sub 2, is greater than open parenthesis, n sub 1 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="n sub 2, is greater than n sub 1, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="n sub 2, is greater than open parenthesis, n sub 1 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mtext>n</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
